text:
sease-Associated Maternal and/or Embryo/Fetal Risk 
In pregnant women with poorly or moderately controlled asthma, 
there is an increased risk of preeclampsia in the mother and 
prematurity, low birth weight and small for gestational age in the 
neonate. The level of asthma control should be closely monitored 
in pregnant women and treatment adjusted as necessary to 
maintain optimal control. 
FDA/CDER/OND/ODEIV/DPMH 26
